description: Usually 'rlogin' is a symlink to 'ssh' the following works only when the real 'rlogin' is used (e.g., from the 'rsh-client' APT package).

file-upload.description: Send contents of a file to a TCP port. Run 'nc -l -p [port] > [file]' on the attacker system to capture the contents. 'rlogin' hangs waiting for the remote peer to close the socket. The file is corrupted by leading and trailing spurious data.
